text: Bottle as part of a JK tasting. Having this as part of a Jester King fruited sour tasting made two things clear: 1) JK knows how to build a beautiful wild, sour beer, since all of their barrel aged stuff has a great combination of barnyard funk and a sharp acidic bite, and 2) this has to be their best fruited sour. The cherries balance the tartness extremely well, allowing both flavors to come through before hitting a nice, drying balance. Theres also a nice, earthy cherry flavor that really cuts through; its never sweet, but its very prominent and it goes well with the rest of the beer. Theres a lot of flavor in this, and its expertly pulled off.

[5/10/17] Bottle at Himmeriget in Copenhagen. Bottled June 2016. Lovely clear red color. Great aroma full of cherries, cherry pits, juicy, funk, oak, marzipan, cinnamon, sour, lemony, somewhat acidic, medium-bodied, rounded. Really great.

From bottle at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Light hazy red color with off white to pink head. Yeasty and malty aroma, light funky, sweet and tart fruity - cherries, wood. Sweet and acidic fruity taste like aroma. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle @ Himmeriget. Clear deep red with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, cherries, almond, tart, lemon and cherry stones. Flavour is malt, cherries, almond, spices, cherry stones, sweet, tart, cinnamon? and a little sour.
Sampled from bottle. Trübes rötlich pinkes Bier. Geruch ist säuerlich fruchtig, Himbeeren Erdbeeren, Joghurt. Geschmack ist mild holzig säuerlich, holzig Himbeeren, yoghurt

Bottle @ Himmeriget. 
Lots of cherries, sweetness and marzipan. Pretty much same things in flavor. 
Nice, balanced brew.
Tap at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Colour is cloudy red with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Berries, red berries, some sourness and softness. Very good.
Bottled. Reddish coloured. Dense off white jead. Aroma. Berries, spice marcipan . Flavour. Sourness berries spice acidity. Ends sour and citric.

Cinnamon, vanilla aroma. Lovely. Sourish flavour, berries, cherries and vanilla. Flavour does not quite deliver what the aroma promises.
Bottle at himmeriget... Pink red... Small white head.. Soft tart cherry funk fruit nose.. Juicy fruits.. Long tart cherry fruit.. Long cherry stones
Bottle @ Himmeriget. Hazy deep red with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, sweet cherries, cherry stones and tart. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish. 110517

Bottle @ Himmeriget. Pours red with an offwhite head. Aroma of light sourness, little yeast, sweet and tart cherries, almonds, light cinnamon. Flavor is light sour, wood, cherries, almonds, oak. Medium body, soft to average carbonation, light acidic finish. 110517
At Himmeriget, pours rrd with a small head, aroma of cherries, Cinnamon, caramel, lotus, flavor of cherries, cherry seeds, acidic, lemony, medium bodied, great

18/IV/17 - 1Pt. 9Fl. Oz. bottle @ American BBQ Guy Tasting (ElManana+1s place) - BB: n/a, bottled: VI/2016, bout 3 (2017-465) Thanks to Stephen and Kim for sharing the bottle!
Clear bright red beer, small creamy white head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of cherries, sweet candy smell, some almonds. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: soft acidity, fruity, lots of cherries, some tannins, bitter touch. Could certainly pass for a Belgian kriek!

Bottle split at Himmeriget before day 2 of Coconut/Cinnamon Death 2017. Pours hazy orangey red with a small white head and some chunks. Aromas of spicy cinnamon cherries, light acetone, cherries, lactic, almondy notes. Taste is dry, tart, cinnamon, vanilla, cherries, lactic, light raspberry like sweetness.

Batch 3 bottle. Pours cloudy amberish red with a modest pink head which soon recedes. Aroma is cinnamony cherry, hint of vanilla oak, a hint ot acetone. Taste is cherry sweet, cinnamony/spice cherry, oaky vanilla, puckeringly tart with moderate-high levels of acidity. Cherry dominates and compliments the sharp sour taste.

Bottle, shared with friends. Pours clear ruby red, a bit hazy as you get deeper. Small off-white head with a tinge of pink, some residual and lacing. Aroma is cherries for sure, JK funky bugs, wood tannin, more cherry skins. Flavor is light tart and light plus funky. Medium body, soft carbonation. This is excellent.
1/21/17. Thanks djd! Bottle, Bout 3. Red pour with a nice pink head. Awesome sour aroma, funky, tart, awesome cherry character. Great flavor, sour, cherries, funk. Delish!
Holy smokes this beer was amazing!! Thanks Danny and DJ. Bright cherry red color. The nose was a nice soft cherry, but the taste was perfect blend of tart and sweet cheeries. So crisp. Awesome!!!
Bottle, incredible cherry flavors, deep sweet fruit flavors, finish is all cherry. Some light tartness to balance sweet flavors.

Batch 1 bottled Jan 2014, drunk 10/10/16.Lovely cherry pulp-beige-golden body is topped by a small, but dense, pink-flecked head. High clarity leaving plentiful sediment behind.The plaster just pours forth from this thing. Incredibly cleanly-fermented and lagered with no rough edges or messy esters. Even the cherries, still very apparent, hold mostly skin and pit characteristics, with very little malic acidity. Soft, vanilla-honey-tinged malts seem to be quite well-attenuated from the nose. Wheat-like character is present as well. Very elegant brett notes add very light band aid, soft guava-lemon and there is just a hint of gentle lactic acid on the end, mixing with the deep, rich, yet understated cherry character. No alcohol or flaw.Just as breathtaking in the mouth, with even, mellow cherry notes that are nonetheless still very bright and flavorful, especially at 33 months of age...Soft, yet malty, but exquisitely dry with soft, biscuity malt and wheat notes and very fine carbonation. A pinch of lactic acid underscores the cherry and lightly tart brett acids. Mild funk, light band aid and black pepper. Incredibly drinkable and hard to believe its even 6.7% abv. The only thing I could think to possibly complain about here is that its, perhaps, TOO clean and mild. Maybe some more funk would do it nicely, I guess? I dont know, this is pretty divine. And that plastery minerality....

From notes. Enjoyed this during the 2nd Annual Kellys Island Bottle Share on September 18. 500 mL bottle. Batch 2. The pour is a bright red color with a light pink head that falls down quickly leaving no lace. This is sour as hell. The cherry just bursts right out of it. Its got a strong funk, light oak, and a ton of sour cherry. Its clean, to the point. The flavor is much of the same. There is a blast of sour cherry right up front, and slowly the oak and a light vanilla come in. There is a hint of sweetness before the back end, but its well done. The mouth feel is excellent. Tart, crisp, light, with a great carbonation and a puckering sour cherry on the finish. My mouth waters as I finish this, and I want to keep drinking it! JK kills this one.

3 oz pour (bottle?) at Hops & Pie. Vibrant reddish appearance with a white ring of foam. Aroma of sour cherries, funk, light vanilla and a hint of oak. Similar flavor, fresh cherries, tart, sour and puckering with a medium body. Absolutely delicious overall.
500 ml. shared bottle. Pours a somewhat hazy pale red with a small pinkish head. Aroma of fruit, funk, and wood. Taste is tart cherries, funk, and oak. Very nice.
At Fofa. A lovely red pink with a berry aroma. Waxy berry tartness, light acidity, good stuff. 3.9

Pours a hazed ruby red color with no head at all.

Smells of acetic, unripe wild cherries with a gentle funkiness to em, which allows a riper, sweeter fruit quality to unfold on the nose as well, adding to the beers prominent tartness, with an earthy stone pit quality. 

Has a higher, well fitting carbonation, with a light, very refreshing and challenging, complex body.

Tastes of sweet cherries right from the beginning, which turn more sour the longer they remain on the palate. This is due to a sparkly, stony mineral uprising, as well as an uncompromising acetic tartness, which almost swallows the cherry complexity as for its dry and pungent impact. Finishes with more funk, leather, dried hay and old mushrooms among grilled cherry stones, an opposing crispness resulting from white lemon zest and a late but taste defining sweetness of sun ripened cherries.

Wow, this is a great gateway sour between classic Lambics and AWAs. It certainly got a higher acetic level than its belgian counterparts, while it sucessfully lends an unexperienced sweetness to the cherries, like adding salt to caramel, just to emphasize its sweet qualities. It manages to appear naturally with a very silk mid palate and finish, which brings many well desired funky and tart nuances to light, complimenting to the refreshing cherry fruitiness.

RBSG 2016 shared at the Grand Tasting after-party in the hotel lobby. Bottle. Hazy deep pink. Aroma is crushed dark cherries, notes of yoghurt and singed hair. Cherry yoghurt, light vinegar, moderate leathery and cheesy funk character. Very nice.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Sample from bottle at fofa. Bright red pour with thin white head. Aroma is quite nice, tons of cherry, tart cherry, lactic notes, plain yoghurt. Taste is tart, quite lactic and citric, nice cherry flavor, not really sweet. Palate is light-med bodied with good carbonation. Tasty.

Bottle pour at FoFA. Beautiful slightly hazy bright red with a small white head, some retention, leaving little lacing. Aroma is really cheesy and lactic along sweet - but not jammy - cherries, some funk, soft leathery brettanomyces and mild herbal/leafy notes. Taste is moderately acidic with again a rather strong cheesy/lactic presence, more cherries than in the aroma, leathery brettanomyces, mild mineral spiciness and herbal notes. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Lactic and cherries finish. The fruits comes out beautifully in this one. Acidity level is controlled and drinkability is good. Might be a tiny bit too cheesy for my liking but otherwise a world-class cherry sour.

Taste at rbsg hotel. Thanks DJ. Pours a clear reddish purple with no real head. Aromas of big cherry and sour. Taste is sour cherry but not like cough syrup like some can be. I usually dont like cherry sours but this was nice.

Bottle shared at RBSG. The beer is a clear red with a pinkish head of foam. The aroma has rich, sweet cherries. Jammy. Acidic taste that complements the sweet cherry notes. Medium body and medium carbonation. Very nice.
Sampled at rbsg. Bright red with a pink head. A funky berry aroma. Dry malty start. Cherries and berries. Rich malts. Tart cherries. Intereresting. Nice.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2017 Cloudy read color. Small red head. Big 5 gum flavor (cinnamon and cherry taste) cinnamon nose. Medium mouthfeel. Medium sourness Very good

Batch 3 on draft at the source. Bigger cinnamon note than batch 2 fresh. Low sourness. Dark red color.

Another awesome bottle shared by DJ at RBWG. Glad I stayed up late on my last night there to enjoy these with the boys. One of the better American made cherry sours I have had. Reminded me some of 3F Intense Red Kriek. Great balance between cherry flavor and acidity. Really well done.

500 ml bottle shared by djd07- thanks again, DJ! Bout 2, February 2015. Pours a hazy ruby color with a small pink-tinted ring for a head. Big cherry character, tart and earthy, with rose petal, oak, grapes, mild spices, and apple skins. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a tart, fruity, earthy mouthfeel. Excellent cherry sour.

Bottle. Hazy light red liquid with small to medium light pink head. Aroma of cherries, almonds, lemon, light cinnamon and apple skin. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of cherries, cinnamon, light funk, lemon and red apple skin. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Great.

Bottle. Big tart sour cherry nose. Hazy and weirdly bloody red and clear color. Large tart cherry initial, light vinegar, slightly salty with some funk, and a small fruity finish. Thin body, with medium astringency. Smooth as can be.

500 ml Italian-style bottle. PRetty pink-red color with lace. Nice tart cherry nose, a bit of yogurt. Flavor is cherry, including a nuttiness from the stones, and yogurt. Not hugely sour like a lambic, but lovely funkiness.
Bottle share courtesy of Rich. Cherries dominate this brew, sweet and tart. Pours out a nice pink hue, with small frothy head. this ones all about the cherries

Little sexy bottle thanks to Rich. Pours out a maroon berry color topped with a small pink head. Nose is nice cherries wood barrel notes nice funk tart great. Taste is more of the cherries tartness sweetness funk very nice.

500mL bottle, pours an opaque dark reddish brown with a small off-white head. Aroma brings out lightly tart cherries, some light funk, and wood. Flavour is full of pitted cherries, with subtle tartness and some wood to finish it off. Quite a unique flavour profile to it. Woody, pithy and complex. Excellent.
Bottle sample. Hazy to cloudy reddish color, off white head. Aroma of dusty, funky overripe cherries. Taste is softly sour leathery cherry. Good stuff.

Courtesy of umich03jm
Bottle: The aroma consists of light-moderate cherry, more sweet than tart, with a touch of cinnamon and vanilla. Its pours a murky deep pink with a small pink head that quickly fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin ring. The flavor starts with a quick dose of sweet cherry. The finish quickly turns heavily tart with tart cherries, lemon, faint vanilla, cinnamon, and oak. Its medium bodied with mild carbonation.

Bottle thanks to errl! Aroma is packed with sour cherries with some rich honey, light cinnamon and oak. Tastes sweet at first and quickly turns tart and dry by the finish. Loads of tart and slightly sour cherries. Awesome.
Bottle.Hazy deep red beer with an small offwhite/pinkish head. Sour fruitystrawberry funky aroma with rubber notes. Sour Cherry funky Woody red berries hay flavour. Really a nice one :-)
Murky poured at WTWBA. Nose is rich fruits. Tastes of cherry, chocolate, wood, wine, spices, pepper, drying finish. Deep fruit. Very good.
Bottle, bout 2, pour is clear pinkish red with low head. aroma is funky tart cherry.. taste is soft and tart sour with ripe cherry, love this

Bottle. Pours deep red with pink head. Aroma is strong of sweet cherry, fruit forward, light sour funk coming through. Taste is light bodied, medium carbonation, very fruity. Overall, delicious fruit forward beer.

Bottle, courtesy of a chill br, shared in a location remote of my living room. 
Pours a dark pink with a very small head. 

The aroma is funky with some cherry pie, some odd ash, and an all around nice tart on sweet cherry presence. 

The flavor is tart & cherry forward. Its oaky with a nice lever of sourness... again the play on tart cherries and pie cherries is a thing here. I know almost nothing about the two cherry varieties here, but if theyre trying to play a tart cherry against a sweet cherry theyre doing a great job of representing that. The beer has a mild bitterness & is lightly nutty. Its satisfyingly dry for sure. 

Fun

sample at big texas beerfest Semi hazy reddish pour, with an off white head. Super juicy beer, tons of fresh ripe cherries, cherry pie, tartness, mild funk, and oak. This is good, really good fruit beer.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2016 Lightly hazy red pour with a pink head. Aroma is tart cherry, wood, caramel, spice and funk. Taste follows the nose. Very complex with nice sweet notes and great sour notes. Dry palate. Really great beer.

Pours a hazy dark ruby red with pinkish head. Cherries, tartness, and funk on the nose; follows onto the palate. Some slight sweetness from the cherries on the middle of the palate, but well balanced out with a tart and dry finish.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2015 Treasured bottle from my main man errl. Batch 1, with about a year of age on it. Light gusher. Murky brownish red. Amazing nose of tart and earth cherry flesh, woody pits, light funk. Tremendous sour cherry fruit essence still, incredibly smooth, very slight yogurt/lactic quality, no acetic character. Sourness is really kept in check making this highly drinkable and un-fatiguing. A rare sour I could drink a ton of. Probably the best JK beer Ive had to date. Incredible.
Bottle. Pours reddish pink white head. Nose/taste of cherry lemonade, oak, white wine, funky sourness. Medium body.
Nice deep red colored pour. Small white head. Not much in the way of lacing. Pleasant cherry aroma. Very cherry. Awesome cherry taste. Very nice fruit beer.
Bottle shared at pre-BBF14 tating at ABC Beers, Den Haag. Nice light cloudy red colour, little head. Incredibly fuity cherry and red fruit nose, light and tart body, fruity taste. Nice!
Bottle from unknown via Justin D. Pours a bright reds little to no head. Nose bright, slightly Brett, a bit funky. Body lively and a bit dry. Very approachable

Bottle at pre-borefts tasting .
Pours unclear pink-red . No head at all . 
Smell is sour, funky , and reminds a lot of Cantillon funk . Taste is sour , oak, brett , cherry , dry . Very ful ( fleshy-fruityness ) . Nice. Very nice !

bottle shared @ Pre Borefts tasting
No head or carbonation. Hazy red pour. Cherry aftertaste.
Poured murky red with no head. Aroma of sour berries. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, muted cherry, not particularly sour.

Bottle shared at the Pre-Borefts Tasting. Pours hazy red with no head. Aroma of cherries, light funk, light tart red fruit. Flavour is light sweet and light moderate acidic. Light medium bodied with light carbonation.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a lovely pinkisk red with a slight haze and a small, white head. Amazing amareno-like cherry aroma, incredibly deliciois. Medium body, slightly tart, but more dry than really sour. Very intense cherry flavours. A little sulphur. Amazing really. 040914
Wow. Beautiful beer here all around. Huge bouquet do sweet cherry. Flavor is tart cherry. Very sexy.
Plum red with a cotton pink head. Nose is cherry, wood, acidic, sour, and earth. Great palate, tart cherries, faintly acidic, dry, wood, excellent.

Batch 1 from January 2014. Reddish pour with a white head. The aroma is full of a ridiculous amount of cherry notes as well as some light oak. The flavor is also super heavy on the cherries. There is also a bit of oak and some light funk. Very juicy overall with a nice bit of tartness as well as a bit of sugary sweetness. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
Bottle..Pour is pink with a pink head..Nose is a crazy mingle of cherries, funk, juice, amazing funk...Taste is juicy cherry, cherry, dry, tart, herbs, bugs .

Appearance: Pours a cloudy magenta with visible floating yeast and fruit. White film a top.


Aroma: Big cherry pie filling. Subtle funk..

Taste: Sour and sweet cherry. Wild yeast, mild barrel character. Finishes tart. Low bitterness..

Mouthfeel: Mild carbonation. Full bodied,pretty thick for the style..

Overall: The beer was super tasty. With that said, Ive tried a few of these amazing Jester King fruited sours, and they are not very sour. For those lucky enough to have multiples, I am curious to know if these beers get more tart or sour with time. Ill do my best to try and hang on to them longer. Think of New Glarus fruit beers, but more rustic.
Bottle. Pink pour with white head . Spice, cherry and tart aromas. Cinnamon, tart cherry flavors, although the finish is not very sour/tart.

Pour is cloudy dark pink with some chunks floating around and a light pink head. Nose is strong cherry up front with notes of oak and jam. Light musk and brett. Taste has more oak and musk, cherries arent quite as strong, more subtle but well integrated and tasty. Cherry is very pitty and earthy. Body is light and well carbonated on the softer side.

Aroma: Tart Cherries, Cranberries

Appearance: Reddish/Mild Brown Hue, Passes Some Light, Pink Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Tart Cherries, Red Plums, Mild Oak

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Tart, Mildly Drying

Pinkish red color with a small, fleeting head. Bright nose with cherry, cherry pit, and slight oak notes. Bracingly tart up front with a little sweetness coming in. Fruit and oak on the tongue, as it should be. Tangy, dry finish. Very well done.

Dark magenta in color, fair amount of sediment in suspension... Aroma of fresh cherries.... Flavor is slightly acidic and tart up front, not terribly sour, notes of oak... Finishes with bold cherry notes... Amazing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bottle to glass. Red hue with pinkish head. Aroma is lactic, wood, cherries. Mouthfeel is great with a medium light body and sharp zesty carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness throughout with a nice tannic tartness to balance it out. Overall this is a great Kreik brew.

Bottle at the Sippers tasting from Jacquiline the Sipper, 12/05/14.
Lghtly hazed cherry red with a moderate crimson spotting.
Nose is cherry skins, bitter red fruit, smoke, berry sherbets, light smoke, spice, dank cherry tinged straw.
Taste comprises cherry skins, pommegranate, tangy red berry fruits, red wine tinge.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with tarte cherry licks.
Nice easy drinking sour.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle 1 pt 9 fl oz at Fruits of the Foeder, 2014-05-17.Hazy reddish color with fruit particles, very small white head. Cherry, acidic, sugar, cherry pip/stone, almond paste scent. Acidic to sour taste, also almond paste, slight vinegar, some sugar. Fruity aftertaste. Low CO2 mouthfeel, very low bitterness.

Bottle to snifter (shared by Dogbones). Looks good; a semi-transparent pinkish red with foamy light head. Smells good too; tart and funky with notes of cherry. Tastes like it smells with a good mouthfeel. Great beer!

12th May 2014Tasting at Bruces pad. Thanks to Jack the Sipper. Cloudy orange - red beer. No real head. Smooth palate, light fine carbonation. Smooth cherry, lightly sour. Little skins. Sour but not too sour. Touch of lemon. Light finish. Smooth sour cherry beer.

Bottle received in trade. Thank you very much Jeffrey! Pours vibrant hazy red with a frothy pinkish white head that leaves some lacing on the glass while dissipating, smell is very fruity with heavy cherries and sour cherries, lemon juice, hay, dry soil, moist wood, cherry hard candy, unflavored yoghurt and moist wood. Taste is sour and fruity with lemon juice, cherry flavored unsweetened yoghurt, heavy sour cherries, black cherries, moist hay, dry soil, sour grapes moist wood and hints of cherry stones. Mouthfeel is dry, tart, mouth-puckering and light bodied. Finish is sour and fruity with sour cherries, lemon juice, unflavored yoghurt, moist hay, leather, cherry hard candy, lemon zest and moist wood. Concentrated cherry goodness...

Fruits of the foeder @ Alex
Red with large particles. 
Sourish aroma with cherries and cherry-seeds. 
Cherries and cookie-dough in the flavour. Sour.

Bottle at Fruit of the Foeder, 2014-05-17. Cloudy deep red beer with big particles, small offwhite/pinkish head. Sour fruity aroma, cherries, strawberry notes, funky, woody notes, cherry seeds, caramel, some rubber. Sour cherry flavor, funky, red currant, woody, floral, wild strawberries, funky, hay, cherry seeds, hay, grapefruit notes. Sour grassy finish with cherries, citrus and red currant. Really nice!
Flaska på provning hos _angst_ röd oklar dryck med tydliga partiklar. Doft av körsbär. Aning tunn smak av körsbär.

Pours hazy ref with some sediment floating around in glass, fruit it looks like. Aroma is cinnamon cherries sour some.almonds funky. Flavor is sour a bit thin dryish very berry fruity cherries a bit astringent.

Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Jaques Elle. Pours lightly hazy red with a fine, pink frothy head. The nose has clean, dry berries, cherries, raspberries. Medium sweet flavor, moderately funky, sweaty, some raspberry. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Tangy, jammy finish, more raspberry, some cherry, light acidic sweat bite. Lovely stuff.

Bottle @ jack the Sipper. Deep red with a small head. Nose is compote of cherry and cocoa. Some spice. Leaf pile. Very spicy,vibrant cherry and cranberry flavour. Some rhubarb taste. Medium body, soft carbonation. Good.

Bottle thanks to Jack to the L. It pours bright red with a small off white head. The nose is fresh, fruity, blackcurrant, blackcurrant, wood, acidity, light vanilla and decent acidity. The taste is tart, blackcurrant, sherbet, candy, acidity, lemony sherbet, wood, Granny Smith apple and jam with a dry, tart finish. Medium body and prickly carbonation. Fresh, tart and tasty,

500ml bottle in a tulip. Pours reddish pink with a pink head. Aroma of cherries, some light tartness, some funk, light malts, and hints of oak. Flavor the same with a really cool blend. Average texture. A really cool beer.

bottleshare thanks to DexterCat. Pours a slightly murky stark red with no head. Nose catches you behind the gills so to speak. Lightly fruity in the nose but not a lot of cherry per se. Taste is initially very tart and puckering. With some cherry on the flavor, slight tannins. Pretty solid but could use some more cherry, but my taster has been off lately too. Cherry comes thru more as it warms. Some slight wood as well.

Pours a murky deep red color, no head, seems to be some fruit particles. Big cherry aroma, tart, sour, funky, juicy. Big initial sourness, followed immediately by a huge cherry flavor, cherry syrup, very tart and sour. Overall a very fruity, tasty, well balanced sour, very enjoyable.
Bottle sampled at dark lord day. pours a deep hazy red with an off white head. big juicy cherries and slight oak taste

Bottle thanks to Alex. Cloudy, dark red hue. All dem cherries in my face. Fresh, bright fruits. Barnyard funk balances perfectly with the cherries. Zero medicinal character; instead, these two cherries augment each other superbly. JK is killing it these days.
Bottle - Pours light red. Cherries, grassy funk in the nose. The taste is smooth, light cherry. Its good but nothing special.
Bottle. Tart cherries, decent sour, some barrel notes, nice fruited sour beer.

murky ruby, yeast particulates, large bubbled white head dissipates fasts. Musty nose, heavy perfume, lightly acetic berries with decent arsenic. Flavor is heavy berry up front, thin and dry with lots of skin mid and light olive brine through mid, faintest acetone with a sparkling jammy finish despite very dry, sticky, thin end. Very interesting, soft profile allows myriad of subtleties but exposes some off notes.

Thanks to the kind soul who shared this at the Pre-Hunahpu Thursday Tasting. Pours a deep red with a small white head. Nose is big sour cherry, oak, funk, and some mildly sweet cherries as well. Flavor is similar with sour cherry, funk, sweet cherry, vinegar, oak, and as Daknole says "boom." Lots of boom. Light to medium in body and very nice.

50cl, new exclusive American brew Anno 2014, thx alot to Dirk for sharing!, complex sour Kriek, fruity/sour and slightly spicy/woody, balanced, cloudy, nearly no head, very good brew, yet very expensive!
Pours a murky red with no head. Aroma of cherries, redwine, oak and funk. Taste is like eating fresh cherries, hints of oak, redwine and funk. Really awesome sour, crazy cherry presence!
Bottle. Semi hazy reddish pour, with an off white head. Super juicy beer, tons of fresh ripe cherries, cherry pie, tartness, mild funk, and oak. This is good, really good fruit beer.

Bottle @ What the Funk Denver 2014. Pours a cloudy pink appearance with a pink head. Holy shit, the aroma was packed full of juicy, tart pie cherries. A little oak and spritzy carbonation as well. The flavor was packed full of juicy cherries. Some lemon and funk and even a touch of cheese. Moderately tart. Not crazy complex but super delicious. Loved this brew.
Bottle. Pinkish red pour with a smaller head. Tart and slightly sour cherry. Spices. Smooth palate.

Pour from bottle at What the Funk!? 2014. Appearance is hazy maroonish-pink with a frothy pink head and great lacing. Big tart cherries, vanilla, pie crust, graham crackers, cinnamon, strawberry skins, and nutmeg in the aroma. Taste is sweet cherry pie, vanilla, cinnamon, lactic sourness, cherry pit, light lemon, biscuit, and oak. Medium body with soft carbonation. Not quite what Atrial is, but a beautifully crafted fruit sour. Damn this one is tasty!!
Reddish pour at CCB. Man this is good. Cherries burst through, oak followed and a nice plain yogurt backbone. Fruity, oaky, sour. Boom.
Served in a Jester King goblet. Beautiful tart cherries and accompanying skin with moderate lactic acidity.

4/2/2014. Bottle bought at the brewery. Pours ruby red with a pinkish foamy head. It was a bit of a gusher when I opened the bottle. Funky aromas with cherries and hints of oak. The cherry flavors really show through with the oak adding body and muting the sour flavors a bit. The finish is sour, dry and hangs around for a bit. Awesome ale.

Bottle shared at Dunts Tasting (Chicago, IL). Pours a deep reddish crimson hue, darker and well hazed with nice frothy pinkish head. Sticks around as a frothy film, laces well. Aromas are tart cherries, red wine, sour lactic jabs. Some nice spritzy carbonation, lactic elements. Firm cherry. Initial is a bit more inviting, cherry sweet and sour work, some touches of vanillin, oak, some gentle sweetness, red fruit, faint cough drop. Middle is a bit tart, spritzy. Nice dryness as we movve on. Backend is dry, fruity, cherryskin and juice. Some lactic acidity, mellow wine barrel lingers on. Solid. A bit underwhelming for what the nose offers.

Another awesome Sante tasting. A - pours a fantastic berry cherry cider with 1 finger fluffy head. S - holy awesomeness batman. My short review cannot do this awesome beer justice. Aromas of very farmers market fresh cherries on top of a perfectly made cherry cobbler. Notes of cheese funk, lemon, lacto, wet wood. M - med body with a fantastic balance of funk, sour and sweet. Spritzy carb. T - damn. Wished I drank this my self jk. Barnyard and musty cheesfunky goodness really add to the fantastic fresh cherries. Sweet cherry pie with hipped cream, lemon and lacto. O - So effin good this is the best cherry sour/ kriek I've eer had. Jk is onto something 4.5

(Draught) bright cloudy cherry color, fine lasting pink head. Nose of grassy weeds, cherry pie, like the hills and meadows around here which is the idea behind a farmhouse brewery, super complex. Taste of fresh tart cherry, explosion of fresh fruit, pits and all, farmhouse yeast character, ridiculously easy to drink but full of fruit sourness. Amazing stuff.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2015 3/22/2014: At Jesterking with Taylor and Justin. Pours deep cherry red. Aroma is nice and tart, mashed cherries wine. Taste is smooth slight tang sour, cherry, a very nice beer; nothing is harsh, nothing sticks out in a bad way. Finish is wine barrel sourness that ends nice.

3/21/2013: At Jesterking with Justin, Patrick, and Joe Mike. Pours ruby red light. Aroma is very nice funky cherry perfect. Taste is complex subtle cherries, that JK sour funk, greatness. This is neck and neck with Atrial for my favorite beer in Texas, but the acidity is lower on this so I think it would age better and with time will be a more complex and even better beer. I love this beer

On tap at Jester King. Pours a cloudy red with thick frothy pinkish head that lasts leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is oak, cherry skin, and raspberry. Thin mouthfeel with tart cherry, light funk, nice light dryness. Very impressive.
Draft - Sweet cherry and a bit of funk. Bright fascia red with a pink head. Sweet and tart cherry with little funk or barrel but very nice.

Sampled at bottleshare. Amazing deep bright pink color. Lots of sour fruit. I would have said raspberry not cherry. Slight funk very balanced and easy to drink. One of the better fruit sours Ive had.

Pink in appearance,
Amazing cherry taste with a sharp sour and spicy aftertaste. Awesome beer from jester king!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Had on tap at the brewery. Pours a nice pink with a strong aroma of cherries. The taste is sour and cherry up front with a fantastic cherry finish. My favorite of the Jester King sours.
Bottle shared at Pegs. Bright red pour with a white head. Sour cherry aromas. Pungent sour cherry and vinegar notes. Muted caramel malt backbeats. Decent body and mouthfeel.
